clinical_study.brief_title: Education Interventions Model for Rational Drug Use (RDU)
clinical_study.official_title: Education Interventions Model for Rational Drug Use

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop, implement and evaluate an economically viable and efficient interventions education model for rational drug use, adaptable to different pathological situations and should be implemented into Brazil Heath Care System.

detailed_description.textblock: Currently, the educational interventions regarding the use of medicines need to be expanded and more effective, and thus set themselves up in strategies for reorganization of dispensing drugs in health services and provide support to the population to obtain greater control over their health. The pharmacist, in turn, inserted in the multidisciplinary team has an important role in health education with the aim of improving knowledge about the disease and the various treatment options, reflecting positively on treatment adherence and clinical outcomes as a result and quality of life related to patient health. Thus, health education, to share knowledge, represents an important task and involves attentive listening to the community to identify their needs and then solve them. From this perspective, therefore, the educational means to educate health and an integral formation of individuals as social actors critics who understand and question the social relations, transforming subjects into citizens participating in the process of health education, helping to raise awareness , knowledge and understanding of living conditions and relationships with health, promoting quality of life.

primary_outcome.description: To compare the patient´s knowledge of asthma before and after the education interventions with asthma knowledge questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the patient´s pulmonary function before and after the education interventions with spirometry exam.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sociodemographic data, clinical and lifestyle evaluation
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the sociodemographic data, clinical and lifestyle before and after the education interventions and its impact on the quality of life.
To evaluate the technique for using inhalation devices among asthma patients before and after education interventions. Patients will be asked to demonstrate their inhaler technique.
To evaluate the treatment compliance with Morisky&Green test and pharmacy database query before and after educations interventions.
Economic analysis after the model implementation.
To compare the Quality of Life before and after the education interventions

arm_group.description: The patients will receive pharmaceutical education.

intervention.description: The patients will receive pharmaceutical education to know more about asthma, the importance of treatment compliance, the medications used to control the pathology, corrected patients' inhalation techniques and the medication care.
